TopicTitle: Looking for KSP version 0.20.2 or below

Articles.Content:
Hello! For quite a long time, I have been looking for ways to get old versions of KSP (specifically, with the old space center), mostly for nostalgia, but also to play a much less resource-intensive version for a stupidly small computer I have. The oldest version of this era I could find is the demo version 0.18.3. I was wondering if anyone knows a way I can get version 0.20.2,   0.20,   0.19.3, or anything like that.

I have bought KSP (and dlc's) on Steam. I hope this looking for older versions isn't considered pirating. If this is against the rules, I'll take it down.

AFAIK you still can download them using DepotDownloader:

https://github.com/SteamRE/DepotDownloader

You will need to catch the ID's from SteamDB:

https://steamdb.info/app/220200/depots/

1 hour ago, Lisias said:

You will need to catch the ID's from SteamDB:

https://steamdb.info/app/220200/depots/

It doesn't look like they have any IDs for the versions I'm looking for. The earliest it goes back to is 1.2.2. I'm pretty sure version 0.20.2 was before the game came to Steam.

Thanks for the response, though.

Edited June 2, 2022 by To Be Called J

you need to log in via steam on steamdb in order to get older versions than 1.22

Edited July 19, 2022 by Kerbalyer

wait, now it says no such change steamdb only tracks the default public branch

 

Edited July 21, 2022 by Kerbalyer
